description._content: TITLE Bank Block, Keene NH CREATOR SUBJECT Buildings - NH - Keene DESCRIPTION Photograph of the Bank Block under construction on the east side of Central Square at the corner of Roxbury Street in Keene New Hampshire. The Bank Block was built by the Cheshire Provident Institution. The construction "was hampered by an earthquake which occurred when they were nearly completed. Fortunately there was no serious damage...Below the ground were found logs and tree stumps preserved by the moisture of the old Town Brook, some of which were thought to date from early geologic periods; similar wood was found elsewhere in the Square during building construction." There was a fire in 1934 after which the building was remodeled and two upper floors were removed. PUBLISHER Keene Public Library DATE DIGITAL 20071116 DATE ORIGINAL 1870 RESOURCE TYPE photographs FORMAT image/jpg RESOURCE IDENTIFIER hsykbdg049 RIGHTS MANAGMENT No known restriction on publication.
